CSSRotate.summary: The CSSRotate interface of the CSS Typed Object Model API represents the rotate value of the individual {{CSSXRef('transform')}} property in CSS. It inherits properties and methods from its parent .

CSSRotateAngle.summary:
The angle property of the
interface gets and sets the angle of rotation. A positive angle
denotes a clockwise rotation, a negative angle a counter-clockwise one.

CSSRotateCSSRotate.summary:
The CSSRotate() constructor creates a new
object representing the {{cssxref("transform-function/rotate", "rotate()")}} value of the
individual 'transform' property in CSS.

CSSRotateX.summary:
The x property of the
interface gets and sets the abscissa or x-axis of the
translating vector.
CSSRotateX.value: A . Can be set to a number, which is wrapped in a of unit: "number".

CSSRotateY.summary:
The y property of the
interface gets and sets the ordinate or y-axis of the
translating vector.
CSSRotateY.value: A . Can be set to a number, which is wrapped in a of unit: "number".

CSSRotateZ.summary:
The z property of the
interface representing the z-component of the translating
vector. A positive value moves the element towards the viewer, and a negative value
farther away.
CSSRotateZ.value: A . Can be set to a number, which is wrapped in a of unit: "number".
